value: How do I define my pages and their controls as resources and then create the policies about which people or roles should have access to see them when using my application?
Assume my application is ASP.NET MVC Core
assume I'm using Azure AD for authentcation
I don't want to hard code any role name checks in my code
isn't this just hard coding group names in my code
show me the code for the CustomAuthorizationMiddleware
How would I define these claims? What type of objects would they be and how would users be assigned access to them?
how do you define permissions for each app role
so, each protected page or control would be created as an app role in this authorization model
If I want to ndividually control access to each page and control, how would I do that
in this example my pages and controls would be defined as scopes?
but scopes use consent and access can't be assigned or delegated to users like app roles can it?
so, if my model depends mainly on assigning access to users for specific pages and controls, I should create the pages and controls as app roles?
I'm confused about the permissions property for app roles and whether the app role represents my page or does the permission represent my page
what is the difference between these permissions and scopes?
I only see an oauth2Permissions property in the manifest not one named permissions
but that is for scopes and we decided we needed something different since our app won't use consent for permissions but rather assignment
are there limits to the number of app roles per app or app role assignments per user?
I would like to eliminate hard coded string checks for names or roles in my application and for it to receive the list of protected pages and controls a user may access during login
If there is a limit on the number of app roles and I don't want to represent my app resources as groups, how else could I store them?
the claim example is still checking for a hard coded string

Could each protected control or page just have a unique guide and have a check access method that either makes a live REST API call or checks against a list of accessible GUIDs that were retrieved during login either via claims or a REST call?
could this be improved in any way?
show me an example with all of these improvements
What is an OPA partial query or reverse query
How could partial queries be used for my application to make a call and get back a list of rights plus their constraints or context restrictions for a user

Can I get a specific example where my applications has the right CreatePurchaseOrder which is constrained by a country value so users are only authorized to have the right for specific countries based on their assignments. I want to ask OPA if a user has this right and have OPA return the constraints that user has for that right if they do indeed have it

what would the JSON data look like for a few example users and their authorizations where each may or may not have the right and if they do they have it only for one or more country values but not all
given this data, how could my application make a call to OPA to determine if user3 has the right and if so, what are the constraints
Let's add another right called ApprovePurchaseOrder which has the same country constraint
why did you use createinvoice in the example?
thank you
generate an example JSON data file for these rights and a variety of assignments and constraints for 4 users

In my C# application, I have records in SQL for PurchaseOrders which are exposed to my application code using the entity framework. One of the properties of these purchaseorder objects is the country. How could my C# code call opa for a specific user, example, user3 to check if the user has the right to ApprovePurchaseOrder for the purchase order record named acmefireworksPO29289 which has a country value of Norway
Can we make this code more dynamic where it retrieves the PurchaseOrder object and then passes the country value for that object in the OPA call

Can we refactor the code so we don't have to explicitly pass country in the GetConstraintsForUser method instead it will get all constraints the user has for that right. There could be constraints based on country as well as an enum property named CustomerLevel with values of silver, gold, and platinum

Could we refactor the code to check if all constraints are a match to allow access? If only one constraint is assigned and the user is a match then access is authorized. If more than one constraint was specified in the access assignment or policy then all must be met as a match on the object
you are hard coding the cases for each constraint. MAke it dynamic based upon the constraints that come back from OPA for this user and right
assume if the user has the right without any constraints then they are authorized
if the user does not have the right they are not authorized
Can we simplify the else statements so there is an if authorized and one else if you are not that sets the IsAuthorized to false. I don't want to handle each case
this logic doesn't seem to be correct. If constraints is null or count == 0 then the user would be authorized as long as they have the right
just for safety sake, for the case where there are constraints, I would prefer isAuthoized is false until it is evaluated that the user meets all of the constraint requirements
how could this code be improved?
Show me how my code could implement suggestion 5
C

I would like the policies to not be defined in C# code but rather managed centrally and then evaluated using a rego rule that looks at the JSON data of user to application right assignments and their constraints
I want my rego rule to be less hard coded and authorize access is the user has the rights and restraints required in the OPA request

yes, I want two options in my C# code. the first is for the C# application to pass all of the data to OPA to get a true or false answer. the app would pass the user, the right to check and the constraints and the opa rule would check the JSON data file to see if the user had an access grant with the right in question and the constrain values specified by the calling C# application. The second option available in my C# code is to pass the user and the right and OPA returns a result telling if the user has that right and any constraints they have in the assignment. the application would then check against the object in question to determine is the user is authorized or not much like our example where we were checking for the ApprovePurchaseOrder right for acmefireworksPO29289
In example 1, can we make it dynamic like example 2 and pull the required constraint values from the object itself, in this case acmefireworksPO29289
Can we refactor both options as two easy to use methods
and both of these methods work using which example rego rule and JSON data file?
Can we refactor our code, the rego rule, and the JSON file to support their being multiple applications
Can we reorganize the JSON file so the hierarchy is application, then user, then rights and constraints

for application refactor to name the variable AppID. refactor user to be PersonLogin. Refactor right to be AzLocalRight. Refactor the constraint names and values to be called FieldType and corresponding FieldTypeValues
generate an example rego rule, a JSON data file for 10 users, 5 applications, and a random use of fieldtypes for constraints of Country, CustomerLevel, and State
make some of the data in the JSON value have multiple values for the constrain the user is authorized. Example multiple countries
Generate a C# console application that could be used to test both OPA methods

So far we have not had the concept of a resource for our authorization checks. We are assuming the rights and constraints are global for the application. Let's expand our mode to include resources so the rights are specific to a resource type and the constraints are specific to a right and multiple resources of each type exist for an application and the user assigned authorizations grant them rights with constraints for these resources
Let's not use pages and buttons as our resource types but rather Invoices, PurchaseOrders, and Companies
invoiceamount, country, and customerlevel should be single valued for our resources

rights and constraints aren't assigned to resources. The definitions of the rights and fieldtypes and possible values are defined per application resource type but the authorization assignments for these resources are to users
please regenerate the JSON and code based on these new assumptions
For the constraints, we need to define the list of FieldTypes for each resource type right and then for each FieldType a list of possible FieldTypeValues

I don't see where we are listing the possible FieldTypeValues for each field type. I also see that we seem to use Right and AzLocalRight redundantly in the JSON. they are the same thing so just use AzLocalRight
Constraints and FieldTypes are also redundant meaning the same thing. Let's just use FieldTypes
Sorry but in the ResourceAccesses portion of the JSON, let's Rename FieldTypes back to Constraints
none of the user accesses specify a specific resource

Resources of a resource type should not be subnodes of the AzLocalRight. Resource Types have AzLocalRights and AzLocalRights have FieldTypes with possible assignable fieldtypevalues and then the application can have a list of resources of each type which would have single values for properties of their objects that match FieldTypes and the values we have defined
don't specify a specific value in the definition of the FieldTypeValues for invoices
when defining a resource the fieldtype and fieldtype value are not constraints so there is no need for that level in the JSON here
Make the ResourceAccesses scoped to specific resources
The resourceaccesses should not be subnodes under the resources but rather separate from the resource definitions section
You still have resourceaccesses under the resource. Make them a separate section in the JSON file
One change to make is that in the definition of our AzLocalRights and their FieldTypes we no longer list the possible fieldtypevalues
yes - please regenrate the JSON file with this fix

The ResourceType definition should not include the resources themselves. Please separate out the resources into their own section in the JSON. do the same and separate out the ResourceAccesses as well. Both should be under the application but in their own sections
Please modify to make some of the resourceaccesses assignments scoped for specific resources
Reorganize the resourceaccesses to organize by PersonLogin as the first level, then resource as the second level
Instead of grouping ResourceAccesses with a section for each ResourceType, instead just list them together with ResourceType as a property
You also made this change to the ResourceTypes definition section. Please roll that back but keep the other
please finish where you left off
The Resourceaccesses node should be application specific and under their corresponding root AppID node
you did not finish
why didn't you finish?
you ended on the resources section in the middle
Now using this new JSON data format, please regenerate my C# code for the two methods to call OPA and the rego rule
Is passing the ResourceType really need for the rego rule or is it enough to pass the resourceID?
We will ensure the resourceID is unique either as an int or even better a GUID
please rewrite all of it with this new assumption to simplify
You stopped generating in the middle. Can you try again to generate all of it
Can I also get the updated rego rule?
does this code and rule support both of the two methods we discussed? The one to pass in all the data and see if is authorized and the other to pass in the person and right and get the constraints
Can I get the JSON data file again
Can I get the C# code again
not the console app code. the previous code for my ASP.NET Core MVC application but now to work with this JSON data file and rego rules
You stopped at "public static class JsonData". Please give me the code from this point to the end
Can I get the latest version of the REGO rules again
We decided that resourceid would be a unique guid and that resourcetype would not be required. Please update the rego rule based on these decisions
Is there anything that could be done to improve how the C# developer will use this code to make authorization checks? Any way to make it easier for them and less complex
for options 1 and 2, would I still be able to use OPA, the JSON data, and the rego rule we created?
do both meet my requirement of no role or permissions checks based on hard coded strings
which is a better option?
Please generate the code based on option 2

You stopped generating the code here " .Where(x => x["ResourceID"]?.Value() != null &&
 x["AzLocalRightName"]?.Value() == rightName &&
 (string.IsNullOrEmpty". Please generate the rest of the code
How could this code be used in a REACT application
How could my C# code be improved further
Please generate the code with your recommendations 1, 4, 5, 6, and 7

In this authorization model we have designed, assume one of our resource types is DatabaseTable. DatabaseTable has FieldTypes of TableName with possible values of Invoice, PurchaseOrder, and Person. The DatabaseTable resourcetype also has FieldTypes of Country and Company with the same values we have been using for our other resource types. If I were an application developer and my data access layer was entity framework core and my data mode had tables and objects for Invoice, PurchaseOrder, and Person. How could I call OPA to get the constraints a person has for a specified Table and then implement those as filters in my data layer like a where clause

Is there a way I could make this more dynamic and decorate my data access methods to inject my logic to get the constraints for that user for the table resource specified for the read right and add that as additional filters
How would I do this differently if I were using Dapper instead
How could I apply these same type of filters if my application was calling the Elastic Search REST API for data
How would I do the same if my application as using Azure Cognitive Search for data and searching
what would be the rego rule for these new cases to filter data coming from databases and data sources
would my JSON data file need to chane or the same schema we have designed so far would work
You are a clinical tutor for new graduate nurses in New Zealand. Write a unit plan to teach pressure injury assessment and treatment.
Generate a table of the key vocabulary for this unit, with everyday language definitions.
Generate a quiz for lesson 2

Generate 3 case study scenarios about fictional patients of varying ages, with a New Zealand context. Create a series of tasks the nursing students should carry out to engage them in their learning about this topic. Provide / generate any worksheets or resources require.
Generate the resources listed, for use in this case study learning.
Great, now do the same for Lesson 2.
Lets play Dungeons and Dragons. I'm a halfling rogue and you're the DM.
I'm not sure. You make it up for me.
Can you make a character sheet for Finnley?
Ya, this looks great. Can you make 3 other party members to join me on the campaign?
This looks great. Lets start playing. You're the DM but also take on the role of the other 3 party members. I'll just be Finnley.
I ask the guards what clues they have that I could use to find the location or identity of the thief.
I ask my other party members if this symbol means anything to them.
I ask if there is a temple of Selune anywhere in the city.
I approach one of the priestesses and say that I'd like to learn more about Selune and her followers.
I take a seat near hooded follower and wait to see if he acknowledges me.
I ask Elara what she thinks.
I look for other leads and suspects but I make sure that we have a way to find Maric again in the future.
Lets proceed with the adventure.
Who in the party has the best perception?
Lets have Elara check for traps before we enter.
Ok, we enter and go upstairs to investigate the noise.
I use stealth to try and get within grabbing distance of the figure without them noticing me.
I grab the figure and remove their mask.
I ask Maric what he's doing here.
I try to help him. I ask him where he was taking the stolen loot.
I ask Maric what happens in the temple.
Does the figure see us?
I have Elara ready her bow to fire at the figure while I try to stealth close enough to grab them.
I jump on her back and try to restrain her.
Lets get back to the campaign. I ask the figure we've just apprehended about the crescent moon tattoo on her forehead.
I think thats enough for me for tonight. Lets save this place and come back to the campaign later.

Which one is correct? if the two sentences are correct could you tell me the difference between these two sentences?"
URL: https://forum.wordreference.com/threads/continue-to-write-or-writing.3015911/

[3] "Please pardon the intrusion. I apologize for the interruption. Excuse me, I didn't mean to interrupt. and various others. To suggest everyone should continue what they are doing: Don't mind me. Create a case study based on the job description below. Include discussion questions. I want you to ask questions before creating the case study to ensure your understanding.

Job Description:
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok.

The commerce industry has seen tremendous growth in recent years and has become a hotly contested space amongst leading Internet companies, and its future growth cannot be underestimated. With millions of loyal users globally, we believe TikTok is an ideal platform to deliver a brand new and better commerce experience to our users. We are looking for passionate and talented people to join our product and operations team, together we can build an commerce ecosystem that is innovative, secure and intuitive for our users.

What You'll Do
Responsible for data analysis of e-commerce overseas operation strategy including Merchant Strategy, Creator Strategy, etc.
Describe the situation of businesses, explain the fluctuations of business and provide valuable suggestions with reports.
Design the monitoring systems independently to reflect any changes of business in time
Cooperate with Ops team to set strategy, e.g. finding potential creators, measuring LTV of users, figuring out the growth strategy of merchants, etc.
Follow up the data analysis of local operation teams in several overseas markets, support the operation effect and give the follow-up optimization suggestions;
Cooperate with PM/Ops/R&D team, promote the implementation of optimization scheme, and bring about the actual improvement and growth of business
Qualifications
Who We're Looking For
Bachelor degree or above, major in mathematics, statistics, computer science is preferred; or major in science or engineering or engaged in data statistics, analysis, modeling related working areas after graduation
Proficient in SQL and tableau and familiar with Python or R for data analysis.
At least 3 years of working experience in data analysis, and have a good business sense in e-commerce
Overseas working experience or analytical experience is preferred
Able to complete English reports and communicate with global staff independently
Have a strong learning ability and curiosity; familiar with starting a new business; able to lead a small project team to support business
Have a strong ability to work under pressure, have the courage to overcome difficulties and accept challenges
Answer each question for me. Don’t create the case study just yet.

Use these answers for the case study. Create a real-world scenario that the data analyst may encounter for the case study. Write in the style of a Harvard business case study. Define the business problem in the form of a question and do not use a generalized problem. Make the problem as specific as possible. You can even make up numbers. Do not provide a solution.
Create a sample dataset to match the case study.
Add features to the dataset that may be good candidates for supervised machine learning.
Using this data as inspiration for possible values, give me the Python code so I can create a synthetic dataset of 1,000 rows.
Incorporate issues 1-4 into the Python code to generate the data set.
Ensure there are duplicates
How many possible duplicates will appear?
What I meant by duplicates is duplicate rows
What kind of data available via an API can enrich the dataset to support the case study’s business problem?
Where can I get product review data via an API?
How would I request the reviews for a retail merchant from the Yelp Fusion API in Python? Only use the requests and json libraries.

Give me the python code to scrape the text that starts with “This is one of our first” from this html:
[![](https://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/1a/f6/e9/ef/default-avatar-2020-66.jpg)](/Profile/380kurtt)[Kurt T](/Profile/380kurtt) wrote a review May 20222 contributions1 helpful vote![](https://dynamic-media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-o/23/59/22/4b/the-hotel-entrance-invites.jpg?w=1200&h=200&s=1)[Always a treat to stay here!](/ShowUserReviews-g31352-d324197-r837715141-El_Portal_Sedona_Hotel-Sedona_Arizona.html)This is one of our first trips out since COVID hit, and the hotel was as terrific as ever. We love the feeling of seclusion this place has even though it is right in the heart of the arts district. As we sat in the shaded courtyard, it was so relaxing to hear all the small birds and the breeze rustling the shade trees. An oasis in the desert. Our room was so comfortable (as all the ones we've stayed in have been). We slept soundly. Waking up to having a generous continental breakfast (great coffee, pastries, muffins, toast, yogurt) out in the great room started the morning right. Despite the privacy and seclusion that El Portal offers, we also were able to meet and make friends with some wonderful guests. The smiles on everyone's face say it all. Create 2 slides out this text. Use an action-oriented, takeaway title and bullets that will fit on one line. Text:
Good news! Based on the regression statistics we analyzed, we found a strong positive relationship between the performance of our stores and the employee count and store square footage. This means that increasing the number of employees and expanding the size of the stores could lead to higher sales growth. However, we also found that the hours open per day did not have a statistically significant impact on store performance. Therefore, we recommend that we focus on hiring more employees and/or expanding the size of the stores to boost sales growth.

In terms of cost reduction, we found that the employee count has a negative relationship with the performance of our stores, which means that having fewer employees could lead to lower costs. However, we also found that reducing the number of employees could hurt sales growth, so we need to strike a balance between cost reduction and sales growth. Moreover, the store square footage has a positive relationship with store performance, which means that reducing store size could hurt sales growth. Therefore, we recommend that we focus on optimizing the employee count and store size to achieve a balance between cost reduction and sales growth."

Comment and explain this SQL:
SELECT COUNT(\*) AS CategoryCount
FROM
(
 SELECT 
 CategoryDescription, 
 COUNT(\*) AS ProductCount,
 (
 SELECT AVG(ProductCount)
 FROM
 (
 SELECT CategoryDescription, COUNT(\*) AS ProductCount
 FROM Products
 JOIN Categories
 ON Products.CategoryID = Categories.CategoryID 
 GROUP BY CategoryDescription 
 ORDER BY ProductCount DESC
 ) AS ProductCountsByCategory
 ) AS AvgProductCount
 FROM Products
 JOIN Categories
 ON Products.CategoryID = Categories.CategoryID 
 GROUP BY CategoryDescription
 HAVING ProductCount > AvgProductCount
) AS ProductCountGreaterThanAvg;
Optimize the SQL for readability
Optimize for performance
Rewrite with CTEs instead of subqueries

Version control with Git, like OSS projects?

Current process: https://confluence.rakuten-it.com/confluence/display/ss/How+To+Add+A+New+Vulnerability+Template

(AARON) Too many teams groups

Consolidate Pre-release group chats across Taiwan & JPN

Create distinct communication channels, appoint specific roles.

(Lena) Audit Requests being sent in the last minute (e.g. Pre-release requests gets sent on 3/10 but QA testing has already concluded on 3/3 and the Dev. team would like the audit to start from the next business day)

Add a note at the top of the request form to note that the request should be sent at least 1 month before the Dev. team’s desired audit start date

Audits with no scope listed → make it required field?

(Yamate) Nessus account management

Some auditors are using “recycled” accounts that are originally created for ex-Rakutenians/auditors

Make sure that Shadow and Parallel auditors are arranged before the kick off starts to ensure they can participate as much as they can.

I have a set of images, each a scanned attendance sheet containing a list of handwritten student names. Each image is an attendance sheet from a specific day and we have about 20 of those. I want to write some code, using machine learning (or AI) techniques, to decode the names in each image so that I can create a data.frame, one row for each student, and each row having the following columns: the name of the student followed by their attendance status on each of the days (binary variables). I am comfortable with Python and PyTorch (and numpy, etc.)
I am on a Mac, how do I configure `pytesseract` and acquire the necessary binary?
The images are stored as PDF. Do I need to process them differently? Some PDF might contain multiple of these attendance sheets as separate pages.

based on the case studies below, generate a website idea to solve problems regarding the case studies.

Non-communicable diseases (NCDs), commonly known as chronic diseases,
are health conditions that are not transmittable from person to person. Instead,
they result from unhealthy lifestyles and are influenced by a combination of
genetic, physiological, environmental, and behavioral factors. These diseases
persist over a long period of time (normally more than 1 year) and can be critical
to a person’s health. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), the four
major types of non-communicable diseases are cardiovascular diseases,
cancers, chronic respiratory diseases, and diabetes.
Since 2000, the number of deaths caused by non-communicable diseases
has been steadily rising globally. Research indicates that non-communicable
diseases currently account for 74% of all deaths worldwide, claiming an average
of 41 million lives each year. The leading cause of NCD-related deaths is
cardiovascular diseases, with 17.9 million fatalities annually. Cancers and chronic
respiratory diseases also contribute significantly to NCD-related deaths, with 9.3
million and 4.1 million deaths respectively, followed by diabetes, including its
related kidney disease, which accounts for 2 million deaths (WHO, 2022). Non-communicable diseases are a growing concern, affecting individuals of all ages,
not just the late elderly. Each year, 17 million people lost their lives due to non-communicable diseases before reaching 70 years of age, with 85% of these
premature (i.e. 30-69 years of age) deaths occurring in low- and middle-income
countries. The four types of non-communicable diseases mentioned earlier are
the main culprits for the majority of all premature NCD fatalities, accounting for
over 80% of deaths. (WHO, 2022).
The heavy burden of non-communicable diseases among individuals of
working age results in elevated healthcare expenses, reduced work capacity, and
financial instability. This unseen epidemic is a frequently overlooked source of
poverty and impedes the economic growth of numerous countries. Its impact is
intensifying, as the number of individuals, households, and communities affected
is on the rise and shows no signs of slowing down. Unfortunately, the occurrence
of premature NCD deaths is more prevalent in low- and middle-income countries.
The major cause of this might be due to the rapidly growing population, lacking
access to high-quality healthcare services, practicing unhealthy lifestyles, and
poverty. Additionally, 77% of all NCD deaths, regardless of age group, occur in
low- and middle-income countries. This is a concerning issue as NCDs are chronic
in nature and demand substantial investment in terms of time and money for
treatment, which can result in financial strain for individuals from low and middle-income countries.
rtunately, most non-communicable diseases are preventable. Most non-communicable diseases are caused by common, modifiable risk factors such as
tobacco use, excessive alcohol consumption, unhealthy diets, and physical
inactivity. By adopting healthy lifestyle habits, the community has the potential to
prevent up to 80% of strokes, heart diseases, type 2 diabetes, and over one-third
of cancers from taking place. In conclusion, the rise of non-communicable
diseases is not an issue to be taken lightly, as it is the root cause of widespread
fatalities, underlying health concerns, and weakened economic development on
a global scale, particularly in low- and middle-income countries. The impact of
these diseases on global health is a clarion call, urging us to act swiftly and
decisively to prevent and take respective actions to put an end to them. To
effectively address this growing health crisis, we must employ effective
prevention and management strategies by utilising the existing knowledge we
have today to brainstorm new innovative and cost-effective solutions
